result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard J Litt Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 49 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Cases 16CM862 and 16CM1748, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through.
No contact with Amanda O. except with her permission and under her conditions then no violent contact.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 30 DAYS:  Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, commencing FORTHWITH.
LAST 60 DAYS ARE STAYED to be used at the agent's discretion.

6/14/17 - Court reviewed and ordered the following:  I am denying his request. No sentence modification.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Leonard J Litt in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
(2) victims presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  22 Months
Initial Confinement:  16 Months.
Extended Supervision:  6 Months.
49 Days Credit
Concurrent to:  cases16CM862 & 16CM1748
STAYED.   

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Anger Management or D. V. Counseling and follow through.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Amanda O. except with her permission and under her conditions then non-violent contact.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

CONDITION TIME:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 30 Days to be served - FORTHWITH.
Last 60 Days - Stayed - To be used at the agents discretion.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
